KA.AQWE.content: freedom: all that is required for enlightenment > make public use (öffentlichen Gebrauch) of reason in all matters > God tells us to argue [Babel?] > enlightenment over revolution
KA.AQWE.linkedContent: freedom: all that is required for enlightenment > make public use (öffentlichen Gebrauch) of reason in all matters > God tells us to argue [Babel?] > enlightenment over revolution

KA.AQWE.content: government should let everyone use his own reason in all matters of conscience
KA.AQWE.linkedContent: government should let everyone use his own reason in all matters of conscience

KA.IUHCI.content: nature intends man beyond nature: nature does not do things superfluously > nature has give man the capacity not to follow inclination or instinct but to produce it out of himself [is this a paradox?] > man’s kindness of will achieved by man’s own work > “nature intended that man should owe it all to himself”

KA.IUHCI.content: rationalizing wars [colloquially vs. philosophically] > great union of nations, united will of them all > all wars so many attempts to bring new relations about states and to form new bodies (break up the old)
KA.IUHCI.linkedContent: rationalizing wars [colloquially vs. philosophically] > great union of nations, united will of them all > all wars so many attempts to bring new relations about states and to form new bodies (break up the old)

KA.IUHCI.content: a state, through laws, can maintain itself automatically [?] > if one presumes all these events will result in nothing, that the species is just preparing us for a hell of evils

KA.EP.content: the 3 principles of republican constitution: freedom, dependence on common legislation, equality of all as citizens

KA.EP.content: all men who can mutually affect each other belong under a joint civic constitution: State, international, cosmopolitan
KA.EP.linkedContent: all men who can mutually affect each other belong under a joint civic constitution: State, international, cosmopolitan

KA.EP.content: all forms of government that are not representative are despotic > democracy always a despotism [?] [p. 444]: all want to be ruler

KA.EP.content: pacific union: end all wars > federalization possesses objective reality: how a republic can provide the central core for the federal union [?]

KA.EP.content: violation in one place—felt in all others
honesty is better than all politics is the condition of all politics > the groove [lookup] of duty

KA.EP.content: lawyers fake a priori knowledge > all is right and proper in a formal order

KA.EP.content: if only politics dared to allow philosopher to publicize his maxims [?] > must be in accord w/ general purpose of the public > all maxims that must be made public to function are good! [BUT?!?!?!] > even if only in an infinitely gradual approximation, then the eternal peace …
